alert.note: Alert for Bell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 02 at 7:32PM CDT until April 02 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL BELL COUNTY... At 732 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Killeen, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Harker Heights around 735 PM CDT. Nolanville around 740 PM CDT. Stillhouse Hollow Lake around 745 PM CDT. Belton and Salado around 750 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Union Grove and Woodland. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter now! Get to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building and avoid windows. If a tornado or other severe weather is spotted, report it to the National Weather Service or your local nearest law enforcement agency who will send your report. This act may save lives of others in the path of dangerous weather.
